storyTitle: As Employee, I want to receive notifications when assigned tasks to achieve timely awareness

testCases.title: Validate notification delivery upon task assignment
preconditions: Manager user account is active and logged into the system
Employee user account is active with valid email address configured
Task management module is accessible and functional
Email service is configured and operational
Employee has access to system inbox and email client

steps.action: Manager navigates to task creation page and creates a new task with all required fields (title, description, due date)
steps.expectedResult: Task creation form is displayed and accepts all input data

steps.action: Manager assigns the created task to a specific employee from the employee dropdown list
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully selected and assigned to the task

steps.action: Manager clicks 'Save' or 'Assign' button to complete the task assignment
steps.expectedResult: System displays success message confirming task assignment and notification is triggered within 5 seconds

steps.action: Employee logs into the system and navigates to the system inbox/notifications section
steps.expectedResult: System inbox displays the new task assignment notification with task details (task name, assigned by, due date)

steps.action: Employee checks their registered email inbox for notification email
steps.expectedResult: Email notification is received containing task assignment details matching the system notification

steps.action: Employee clicks on the notification in the dashboard to view full details
steps.expectedResult: Notification details are displayed correctly showing complete task information including task title, description, assigned by manager name, assignment date, and due date

postconditions: Task assignment notification is marked as delivered in the system
Notification appears in employee's system inbox
Email notification is sent to employee's registered email address
Notification delivery is logged in the system audit trail
Employee can access the assigned task from the notification

testCases.title: Verify notification delivery logging
preconditions: Manager user account is active and logged into the system
Employee user account is active in the system
Notification logging system is enabled and functional
User has administrative access to view notification logs
Task assignment functionality is operational

steps.action: Manager creates a new task with all required information (title, description, priority, due date)
steps.expectedResult: Task is successfully created in the system

steps.action: Manager assigns the task to an employee and saves the assignment
steps.expectedResult: Task assignment is completed successfully and system confirms the assignment

steps.action: System automatically triggers notification delivery to the assigned employee
steps.expectedResult: Notification is sent to employee via system inbox and email, and delivery event is logged in the system

steps.action: Administrator or authorized user navigates to the notification logs section or audit trail
steps.expectedResult: Notification logs page is displayed with search and filter options

steps.action: User filters or searches for the notification log entry by employee name, task ID, or timestamp
steps.expectedResult: System displays the relevant notification log entry

steps.action: User reviews the log entry details including timestamp, recipient, delivery status, notification type, and task reference
steps.expectedResult: Log entry accurately reflects the notification event with correct employee name, task ID, delivery timestamp (within 5 seconds of assignment), delivery status (success/failure), notification channels (system inbox and email), and matches the actual notification sent

postconditions: Notification delivery log entry is permanently stored in the system
Log entry contains complete audit information (timestamp, recipient, task ID, delivery status, channels)
Log data is available for compliance and audit purposes
System maintains data integrity of notification logs

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to update task status to achieve transparent progress tracking

testCases.title: Validate successful task status update
preconditions: Employee user account is active and logged into the system
At least one task is assigned to the employee
Task is in a valid initial status (e.g., 'Not Started' or 'Assigned')
Manager user account is active to receive status update notifications
Task status update functionality is enabled and accessible
Employee has authorization to update task status

steps.action: Employee logs into the system and navigates to 'My Tasks' or 'Assigned Tasks' section
steps.expectedResult: List of assigned tasks is displayed showing task names, current status, due dates, and other relevant information

steps.action: Employee identifies and clicks on a specific assigned task from the list
steps.expectedResult: Task details page is displayed showing complete task information including title, description, current status, assigned by, due date, and priority

steps.action: Employee locates the status field or status update dropdown on the task details page
steps.expectedResult: Status update control is visible and accessible with predefined status options (e.g., Not Started, In Progress, Completed, On Hold)

steps.action: Employee selects 'In Progress' from the status dropdown menu
steps.expectedResult: Status dropdown displays 'In Progress' as the selected option without any errors

steps.action: Employee clicks 'Save' or 'Update Status' button to submit the status change
steps.expectedResult: System processes the update within 2 seconds and displays a success message confirming the status update

steps.action: Employee verifies the updated status is reflected in the task details page
steps.expectedResult: Task status field now displays 'In Progress' and the update timestamp is shown

steps.action: Employee navigates back to the task list view
steps.expectedResult: Task list displays the updated status 'In Progress' for the modified task

steps.action: Manager checks their notifications or task monitoring dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Manager receives real-time notification about the status update showing employee name, task name, old status, new status, and update timestamp

postconditions: Task status is permanently updated to 'In Progress' in the database
Status change is visible to all authorized users (employee and manager)
Manager receives notification of the status update
Task list and task details reflect the updated status
System logs the status change event with timestamp and user information

testCases.title: Verify rejection of invalid status transitions
preconditions: Employee user account is active and logged into the system
Task is assigned to the employee with a specific current status
System has defined status transition rules (e.g., cannot move from 'Completed' to 'Not Started')
Task status validation rules are configured and active
Employee has access to task status update functionality

steps.action: Employee logs into the system and navigates to the assigned tasks list
steps.expectedResult: List of assigned tasks is displayed with current status for each task

steps.action: Employee selects a task that is currently in 'Completed' status
steps.expectedResult: Task details page opens showing the task with 'Completed' status

steps.action: Employee attempts to change the status from 'Completed' to 'Not Started' (an invalid backward transition)
steps.expectedResult: Status dropdown allows selection but system prepares to validate the transition

steps.action: Employee clicks 'Save' or 'Update Status' button to submit the invalid status change
steps.expectedResult: System validates the status transition and detects it as invalid according to business rules

steps.action: System processes the validation and responds to the invalid transition attempt
steps.expectedResult: System displays a clear validation error message (e.g., 'Invalid status transition: Cannot change from Completed to Not Started') and blocks the update from being saved

steps.action: Employee verifies the task status remains unchanged
steps.expectedResult: Task status remains 'Completed' and no changes are saved to the database

steps.action: Employee dismisses the error message and checks available status options
steps.expectedResult: System may optionally display only valid status transition options based on current status, or continue to show all options with validation on submit

postconditions: Task status remains unchanged at 'Completed'
No status update is saved to the database
No notification is sent to the manager
Error message is displayed to inform the employee of the invalid transition
System maintains data integrity by preventing invalid status changes
Validation event may be logged for audit purposes

storyTitle: As Manager, I want to track task status updates to achieve real-time visibility into task progress

testCases.title: Validate display of current task statuses
preconditions: Manager user account exists with valid credentials
Manager has authorization to access task dashboard
Multiple tasks exist in the system with various statuses (Not Started, In Progress, Completed, Blocked)
Tasks have recent status updates recorded in the system
Browser is supported and up to date

steps.action: Open web browser and navigate to the application login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username and password fields

steps.action: Enter valid manager credentials and click Login button
steps.expectedResult: Manager is successfully authenticated and redirected to the dashboard home page

steps.action: Navigate to the manager task dashboard by clicking on 'Tasks' or 'Dashboard' menu option
steps.expectedResult: Task dashboard loads and displays a task list with multiple columns including a status column

steps.action: Verify that the status column is visible and clearly labeled in the task list
steps.expectedResult: Status column is present with header label 'Status' or similar, positioned appropriately in the task list

steps.action: Review the status values displayed for at least 5 different tasks in the list
steps.expectedResult: Each task displays a status value (e.g., Not Started, In Progress, Completed, Blocked) in the status column

steps.action: Cross-reference displayed status values with the latest status updates recorded in the system database or task details
steps.expectedResult: All displayed status values match the most recent status updates for each respective task with 100% accuracy

steps.action: Scroll through the task list to verify status display for additional tasks
steps.expectedResult: Status column consistently displays current status for all visible tasks without any missing or null values

postconditions: Manager remains logged into the system
Task dashboard remains accessible
No data has been modified during the test
All task statuses remain unchanged

testCases.title: Validate filtering tasks by status
preconditions: Manager user is logged into the system
Manager has access to the task dashboard
Multiple tasks exist with different statuses including at least 3 tasks with 'In Progress' status
Tasks with other statuses (Not Started, Completed, Blocked) also exist in the system
Filter functionality is enabled on the task dashboard

steps.action: Navigate to the manager task dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Task dashboard is displayed showing all tasks with their respective statuses

steps.action: Note the total number of tasks displayed before applying any filter
steps.expectedResult: Total task count is visible and includes tasks with various statuses

steps.action: Locate the status filter control (dropdown, checkbox, or filter button) on the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Status filter control is visible and accessible on the dashboard interface

steps.action: Click on the status filter control to open filter options
steps.expectedResult: Filter options are displayed showing available status values (Not Started, In Progress, Completed, Blocked)

steps.action: Select 'In Progress' status from the filter options
steps.expectedResult: 'In Progress' option is selected/highlighted in the filter control

steps.action: Apply the filter by clicking 'Apply' or 'Filter' button, or observe auto-filtering if enabled
steps.expectedResult: Task list refreshes and updates to display only tasks with 'In Progress' status

steps.action: Verify that all displayed tasks show 'In Progress' in their status column
steps.expectedResult: 100% of visible tasks have 'In Progress' status; no tasks with other statuses are displayed

steps.action: Verify the task count matches the expected number of 'In Progress' tasks
steps.expectedResult: Displayed task count matches the number of tasks with 'In Progress' status in the system

steps.action: Clear the filter or select 'All' to return to unfiltered view
steps.expectedResult: Task list updates to show all tasks again, regardless of status

postconditions: Filter can be cleared and reapplied
Task list returns to showing all tasks when filter is removed
No tasks have been modified during filtering
Manager remains logged in and on the dashboard

storyTitle: As Manager, I want to receive alerts for overdue tasks to achieve proactive task management

testCases.title: Validate alert generation for overdue tasks
preconditions: Manager user account exists with valid email address configured
Manager has authorization to create and view tasks
Alert generation service is running and operational
Email notification service is configured and functional
System time is accurate and synchronized
Alert generation cycle runs at least every 1 minute

steps.action: Log into the system as a manager user
steps.expectedResult: Manager is successfully authenticated and logged into the system

steps.action: Navigate to the task creation page or form
steps.expectedResult: Task creation interface is displayed with all required fields

steps.action: Create a new task with title 'Test Overdue Task', assign to an employee, set deadline to yesterday's date, and set status to 'In Progress' (incomplete)
steps.expectedResult: Task is successfully created with deadline in the past and incomplete status

steps.action: Save the task and note the task ID or name for reference
steps.expectedResult: Task is saved to the system and task ID is visible

steps.action: Verify the task is marked as overdue in the task list or task details
steps.expectedResult: Task displays an 'Overdue' indicator or flag, confirming it is recognized as overdue by the system

steps.action: Wait for the alert generation cycle to complete (maximum 1 minute as per SLA)
steps.expectedResult: Alert generation service processes the overdue task within 1 minute

steps.action: Navigate to the manager dashboard and locate the alerts section or notification area
steps.expectedResult: Alerts section is visible on the dashboard

steps.action: Verify that an alert for the overdue task appears in the manager dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Alert is displayed in the dashboard showing the task name 'Test Overdue Task' and indicating it is overdue

steps.action: Open the manager's email inbox associated with the manager account
steps.expectedResult: Email inbox is accessible

steps.action: Check for email notification about the overdue task
steps.expectedResult: Email notification is received with subject line indicating overdue task, containing task details including task name, deadline, and overdue status

steps.action: Verify email content includes relevant task information and actionable details
steps.expectedResult: Email contains task name, original deadline, days overdue, and link to view task details

postconditions: Overdue task remains in the system
Alert remains visible in dashboard until dismissed
Email notification remains in inbox
Task status remains unchanged
Manager remains logged in

testCases.title: Verify alert dismissal functionality
preconditions: Manager user is logged into the system
At least one overdue task alert is visible in the manager dashboard
Alert was generated by an overdue task
Manager has permission to dismiss alerts
Dashboard is fully loaded and responsive

steps.action: Navigate to the manager dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Manager dashboard is displayed with all sections loaded

steps.action: Locate the alerts section or notification panel on the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Alerts section is visible showing one or more overdue task alerts

steps.action: Identify a specific overdue task alert and read its content
steps.expectedResult: Alert is clearly visible with task name, overdue status, and relevant details displayed

steps.action: Note the task name or ID from the alert for verification purposes
steps.expectedResult: Task identifier is recorded for post-dismissal verification

steps.action: Locate the dismiss button, close icon (X), or dismiss action associated with the alert
steps.expectedResult: Dismiss control is visible and clearly associated with the alert

steps.action: Click the dismiss button or close icon to dismiss the alert
steps.expectedResult: System processes the dismiss action without errors

steps.action: Verify that the alert is immediately removed from the dashboard alerts section
steps.expectedResult: Alert is no longer visible in the alerts section; it has been removed from the display

steps.action: Refresh the dashboard page to confirm alert dismissal persists
steps.expectedResult: After page refresh, the dismissed alert does not reappear in the alerts section

steps.action: Verify that the underlying overdue task still exists in the task list
steps.expectedResult: Overdue task remains in the task list with overdue status; only the alert was dismissed, not the task itself

postconditions: Alert is permanently dismissed and no longer visible
Overdue task remains in the system unchanged
Manager can still access task details if needed
Alert dismissal is recorded in the system
Manager remains logged in and on dashboard
